body:
Hi,
I'm trying to load mpi4py in spack, but I cannot resolve between two versions apparently present.
The problem is that they look exactly the same version, beside a weird alphanumeric ID I don't understand how to use. I report this as a bug because as long as I could see on the documentation, such type of spec. to be used to resolve versions is not specified.

### Steps to reproduce the issue
mariano@mariano-HP-Pavilion-15-Notebook-PC:~$ spack load py-mpi4py
### Error Message
==> Error: py-mpi4py matches multiple packages.
  Matching packages:
    sznaq64 py-mpi4py@3.0.3%gcc@7.5.0 arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-skylake
    kbd7nic py-mpi4py@3.0.3%gcc@7.5.0 arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-skylake
  Use a more specific spec.



### Information on your system
$ uname -a 
Linux mariano-HP-Pavilion-15-Notebook-PC 5.3.0-42-generic #34~18.04.1-Ubuntu SMP Fri Feb 28 13:42:26 UTC 2020 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
$ lsb_release -d
Description:	Ubuntu 18.04.4 LTS
title: cannot resolve matching packages
